title: Real Madrid news: Brahim Diaz 'rejected all loan offers last summer'
text:
Brahim Diaz rejected the opportunity to leave Real Madrid on loan last summer despite the La Liga giants receiving a number of offers for him.

According to Spanish newspaper AS, the former Manchester City youngster was determined to force his way into Zinedine Zidane's starting XI.

However, after returning from injury he has struggled to make an impact and is yet to play a single minute of football so far this season.

Brahim Diaz, pictured in action last season, is yet to play a minute for Real Madrid this term

The report claims that Real were keen to allow Diaz to leave on a temporary basis in order for him to gain first team experience.

But the 20-year-old and his father Sufiel, who acts as his agent, decided that he would be better off staying at the Bernabeu.

The decision has backfired on Diaz so far, with Eden Hazard, Gareth Bale, Lucas Vazquez and Vinicius Junior all ahead of him in the pecking order.

Zinedine Zidane is an admirer of Diaz but is yet to find a place for him in his side this season

AS says that Diaz is a player Zidane 'loves' and the midfielder remains hopeful that he will be able to work his way into the side as the season goes on.

Malaga were among the clubs interested in signing the Spain Under 21 star, who only joined Los Blancos in a £22million deal from City last January.
description: Brahim Diaz rejected the opportunity to leave Real Madrid on loan last summer despite the La Liga giants receiving a number of offers for him.
